question: Which waterbody forms the coastline of the Commonwealth of Dominica?
explanation: The Caribbean Sea forms the coastline of Dominica, officially Commonwealth of Dominica. Dominica is an island country located in the Caribbean Sea. It is a part of the Windward Islands of the Lesser Antilles Archipelago. In the Eastern Caribbean Sea, the island country of Dominica is located about halfway between the French islands of Guadeloupe (to the north) and Martinique (to the south). The capital of Dominica is Roseau.
